title: Originality and Plagiarism
content: Create Original Work: Authors must ensure that the work they submit is original and has not been published elsewhere. Any use of other people's work must be properly cited.
Avoid Plagiarism: Plagiarism in any form, whether copying anotherâ€™s work or self-plagiarizing by reusing substantial parts of their own previously published work, is unacceptable.

title: Authorship
content: Credit Properly: Only those who have made a substantial contribution to the research or writing should be listed as authors. Others who contributed less can be acknowledged.
Order of Authors: The order of authors should reflect the degree of contribution to the research.
Consent of All Authors: All listed authors should approve the final version of the paper and agree on its submission for publication.

title: Accuracy and Honesty in Reporting
content: Provide Accurate Data: The data presented in the paper should be accurate, properly recorded, and interpreted objectively. Manipulation or fabrication of data is considered unethical.
Report Errors: If an author discovers a significant error or inaccuracy in their own published work, they must promptly notify the journal and cooperate with retraction or correction.

title: Acknowledging Sources
content: Cite Relevant Work: Proper citation of all sources, including methods, data, and ideas, is crucial. Authors must acknowledge the work of others that has influenced their research.
Permission for Reuse: If authors use figures, tables, or text from another publication, they must obtain permission and properly credit the source.

title: Conflict of Interest
content: Disclose Conflicts: Any financial or other conflict of interest that could influence the results or interpretation of the manuscript must be disclosed. This ensures transparency in the research.

title: Ethical Research Conduct
content: Follow Ethical Standards: Authors must adhere to ethical guidelines in research, including obtaining approval from appropriate bodies for research involving humans or animals.
Avoid Harm: Research should be conducted in a way that minimizes potential harm to participants or the environment.

title: Compliance with Journal Policies
content: Follow Journal Guidelines: Authors must adhere to the submission and editorial guidelines of the journal, including formatting and length requirements.
Respect Peer Review: Authors should participate in the peer-review process in good faith and respect the decisions and feedback provided by reviewers and editors.

title: Multiple Submissions
content: Avoid Duplicate Submissions: Authors should not submit the same paper to more than one journal simultaneously, as it wastes time for reviewers and editors and breaches journal policies.
